array.name: PFIFO

reg32.name: SUBFIFO_ENABLE
reg32.bitfield: XXX: figure out spoon count for all cards

reg32.name: ENG_SUBFIFO_MASK
reg32.doc: If bit x of reg y is 0, then engine y can be used by subfifo x, if it's 1 then it cannot.

array.reg32: busy? XXX: something on 280+ on GF100 too?

reg32.name: NV_PFIFO_PBDMA_MAP
reg32.doc: Engine currently used by given subfifo, or 0x1f for none

reg32.name: NV_PFIFO_PBDMA_MAP
reg32.doc: One for each SUBFIFO, has a mask of handled engines

reg32.name: NV_PFIFO_INTR_BIND_ERROR
reg32.value: validated a channel with POLL_ENABLE, but poll area is disabled
invalidated a channel that was active on one of the subfifos
invalidated a channel that had the PENDING flag?
caused by 0x3f1 poked to 2200 [GF100] or engine id >6 in chan table [GK104]
write a channel instance with target == INVALID [1]
invalidated a channel while it was RUNNABLE and on playlist

array.reg32: wtf is thisexactly? XXX: more bits on GK104

allocated UNK700[*], UNK740[*] on NVCx, but UNK70*[0], NK70*[1], .. on GK104
RO... mthd fifo?

reg32.name: CHAN
reg32.bitfield: XXX what good is a channel without this?

array.name: PSUBFIFO

reg32.name: NV_PPBDMA_SIGNATURE
reg32.value: only low 16 bits have to match

reg32.name: NV_PPBDMA_GP_BASE_HI
reg32.bitfield: XXX: check exact vals and bfs

array.reg32: CRC algorithm: like CRC-32, but with all bits in input bytes in reverse order, result in reverse order, no final xor with 0xffffffff, and initial value of 0 instead of 0xffffffff
running CRC of all IB entries ever submitted
running CRC of current pushbuffer [ie. reset to 0 on every new IB entry]
XXX is that still it on GK104?
1f/1f/0... more copy intr? XXX: figure these out
